description: Replaces strings in data fields using various strategies including simple replacement, regex patterns, bulk operations, and template substitution.

data.info: Data containing strings to be replaced. Can be a list of Data objects, single Data object, or JSON string.

replacement_strategy.info: Method for string replacement: simple (exact match), regex (pattern matching), bulk (multiple replacements), or template (variable substitution).

search_value.info: String or regex pattern to search for in the data fields.

replace_value.info: String to replace the search value with. Can include captured groups for regex.

target_fields.info: JSON array of field names to apply replacements to. If empty, all string fields will be processed.

replacement_map.info: JSON object mapping search values to replacement values for bulk operations.

template_variables.info: JSON object containing variables for template substitution.

case_sensitive.info: Whether string matching should be case sensitive.

whole_word_only.info: Whether to match whole words only (adds word boundaries to regex).

max_replacements.info: Maximum number of replacements per field. 0 means unlimited.

create_backup.info: Create backup of original values in fields with '_original' suffix.

preserve_type.info: Attempt to convert replaced values back to original data type.

errors.no_data: No input data provided for string replacement.
errors.empty_data: Input data is empty or contains no records.
errors.invalid_json: Invalid JSON format in input data.
errors.no_replacement_run: String replacement must be run before accessing this output.
